abstracts.cdata!:
This Indigenous Peoples Plan for the
            Natural Resources Management and Poverty Reduction Project
            for Santa Caterina identifies the history and current
            condition of the various ethnic groups who are
            project-affected, examines the legal structure bearing on
            protection of ethnic minorities and the controlling
            environmental activities to forestall degradation, describes
            the national and governmental agencies as well as the
            nongovernmental organizations who would partner in the
            implementation of this project, and details an action plan
            for involving the indigenous populations at every level of
            project activity. The plan specifically calls for 1) the
            formation of partnerships with local indigenous institutions
            at the micro-catchment level-and whether governmental or
            non-governmental-and the establishment of channels for
            on-going public consultation; 2) the use of facilitators who
            are specially trained in the cultural characteristics of
            each of the ethnic groups who are beneficiaries; 3) the use
            of participative methodologies to involve beneficiaries in
            every stage of project planning in public forums and at each
            of the different decision-making levels; and 4) periodic
            evaluation of the impact of the project on the indigenous
            populations conducted with beneficiary participation and the
            involvement of specialists; and the use of these results in
            revising and adapting the methods used to implement the project.
